ext_weather.name: This Afternoon
ext_weather.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 75, with temperatures falling to around 69 in the afternoon. Northwest wind 5 to 10 mph.

Space Weather Message Code: ALTEF3
Serial Number: 3267
Issue Time: 2022 Nov 07 0500 UTC

CONTINUED ALERT: Electron 2MeV Integral Flux exceeded 1000pfu
Continuation of Serial Number: 3266
Begin Time: 2022 Oct 30 1220 UTC
Yesterday Maximum 2MeV Flux: 8981 pfu

NOAA Space Weather Scale descriptions can be found at
www.swpc.noaa.gov/noaa-scales-explanation

Potential Impacts: Satellite systems may experience significant charging resulting in increased risk to satellite systems.

Space Weather Message Code: SUMXM5
Serial Number: 162
Issue Time: 2022 Nov 07 0040 UTC

SUMMARY: X-ray Event exceeded M5
Begin Time: 2022 Nov 06 2359 UTC
Maximum Time: 2022 Nov 07 0011 UTC
End Time: 2022 Nov 07 0016 UTC
X-ray Class: M5.2
Location: N15E51
NOAA Scale: R2 - Moderate

NOAA Space Weather Scale descriptions can be found at
www.swpc.noaa.gov/noaa-scales-explanation

Potential Impacts: Area of impact centered primarily on sub-solar point on the sunlit side of Earth.
Radio - Limited blackout of HF (high frequency) radio communication for tens of minutes.

Space Weather Message Code: SUM10R
Serial Number: 739
Issue Time: 2022 Nov 07 0034 UTC

SUMMARY: 10cm Radio Burst
Begin Time: 2022 Nov 07 0005 UTC
Maximum Time: 2022 Nov 07 0006 UTC
End Time: 2022 Nov 07 0008 UTC
Duration: 3 minutes
Peak Flux: 740 sfu
Latest Penticton Noon Flux: 131 sfu

NOAA Space Weather Scale descriptions can be found at
www.swpc.noaa.gov/noaa-scales-explanation

Description: A 10cm radio burst indicates that the electromagnetic burst associated with a solar flare at the 10cm wavelength was double or greater than the initial 10cm radio background. This can be indicative of significant radio noise in association with a solar flare. This noise is generally short-lived but can cause interference for sensitive receivers including radar, GPS, and satellite communications.

Space Weather Message Code: ALTTP2
Serial Number: 1143
Issue Time: 2022 Nov 07 0030 UTC

ALERT: Type II Radio Emission
Begin Time: 2022 Nov 07 0011 UTC
Estimated Velocity: 927 km/s

NOAA Space Weather Scale descriptions can be found at
www.swpc.noaa.gov/noaa-scales-explanation

Description: Type II emissions occur in association with eruptions on the sun and typically indicate a coronal mass ejection is associated with a flare event.

Space Weather Message Code: ALTXMF
Serial Number: 286
Issue Time: 2022 Nov 07 0012 UTC

ALERT: X-Ray Flux exceeded M5
Threshold Reached: 2022 Nov 07 0010 UTC
NOAA Scale: R2 - Moderate

NOAA Space Weather Scale descriptions can be found at
www.swpc.noaa.gov/noaa-scales-explanation

Potential Impacts: Area of impact centered on sub-solar point on the sunlit side of Earth. Extent of blackout of HF (high frequency) radio communication dependent upon current X-ray Flux intensity. For real-time information on affected area and expected duration please see http://www.swpc.noaa.gov/products/d-region-absorption-predictions-d-rap.

state.message: Sorry, we're currently closed but we will be open tonight, Monday from 7 - 10PM and next Sunday from 12 - 5PM. Check us out on Facebook.
state.preMessage: In memory of Nicholas Lordi, who passed away on Nov 4th. Nick was a supporter of the Information Age Learning Center (InfoAge) and and the IXR/CDL makerspace. A viewing on Saturday, November 12, 2022 from 2pm - 5pm at O’Brien Funeral Home, 2028 Hwy 35 at New Bedford Rd., Wall Twp. His family asks that if you are so moved, you make a donation to support the expanded Makerspace program at InfoAge..
state.postMessage: To get current updates subscribe to our CDL Mail list or cdl+subscribe@groups.io.
state.blogUpdate: (Title: Makerspace near me ... Can't find CDL - Updated: Oct. 05, 2022)
